text: Hey, I've been curious about your background. How did you end up as a tech recruiter? Hey, that's an interesting story. I actually studied psychology in college. My plan was to become a therapist or counselor, but during my last year, I took a course in organizational psychology and it piqued my interest in the workplace and employee dynamics. That's a cool twist. Did you immediately start working as a tech recruiter after college? Not right away. I worked in a general HR role at a non-tech company first, focusing on training and development. What made you make the jump to tech? I saw that tech companies appreciate innovation and care for their employees' wellbeing. This is directly related to what made me want to become a psychologist. So basically, that's what brought me here. Awesome. It was great to get to know you better.
